meanings.definition: The act or process of moving in a circular or spiral path
meanings.sent1: The toy top's precession fascinated the children as it spun around.
meanings.sent2: The planet's precession around the sun takes a full year.
meanings.sent3: The snail's precession along the garden path was slow but steady.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's graceful precession across the stage mesmerized the audience.
meanings.sent5: The precession of the Ferris wheel against the night sky was a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: A change in the orientation of the rotational axis of a rotating body
meanings.sent1: The gyroscope's precession demonstrated the physics principle in action.
meanings.sent2: The Earth's precession causes changes in the position of the North Star over time.
meanings.sent3: The robot's precession malfunction made it spin in circles comically.
meanings.sent4: The company's precession towards innovation led to groundbreaking discoveries.
meanings.sent5: The precession of the windmill blades created a mesmerizing pattern in the sky.
